sources.title: Barefoot Boy
sources.description: A pampered, snobbish young boy is sent by his father who has served time in prison for a crime he did not commit.

sources.title: Barefoot Boy (1938) FAMILY DRAMA
sources.description:
Stars: Jackie Moran, Marcia Mae Jones, Toto/Terry
Director: Karl Brown

A pampered, snobbish young boy is sent by his father to the country farm of an old friend, where he learns to be a better man. Features Terry, the most known dog in movie history, a.k.a. Toto from The Wizard of Oz.

sources.title: Barefoot Boy (1938) Action, Adventure, Crime Full Length Movie
sources.description:
Scrapping - Romancing - Gang-Busting!
Simple country boy Billy Whittaker, must deal with the arrival of Kenneth Hale, the arrogant, snobbish son of an old friend of Billy's dad. Kenneth looks down on Billy's homespun ways, though he does have eyes for Billy's girlfriend, Pige (Marcia Mae Jones). The trio's adventures include an encounter with a couple of crooks, a visit to a haunted house and some boyish fisticuffs...

Director: Karl Brown
Writer: John T. Neville 
Stars: Jackie Moran, Marcia Mae Jones, Ralph Morgan 
Genres: Classics, Action, Adventure, Crime, Drama, Mystery  

@CultCinemaClassics:

metadata.Plot: Other than using the same title this film has no connection to nor is there any film credit linking it to the poem by John Greenleaf Whittier. In this film, Kenneth Hale, a pampered, snobbish young boy is sent by his father, John Hale, who has served time in prison for a crime he did not commit, down to the country farm of an old friend, Calvin Whittaker. The barefooted, honest and plucky Billy Whittaker, his girlfriend, Pige Bennett, and punky Kenneth get involved with a "haunted" house and a gang of crooks, while Billy helps make a "better man" out of Kenneth.
metadata.Actors: Jackie Moran, Marcia Mae Jones, Ralph Morgan
